summary: Lance W Svendsen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail his position and salary within the committee. The consistent appearance of his name across these reports indicates his sustained employment during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Lance W Svendsen's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational aspects of the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the HSCA's activities.
